article.description:
If Peja Stojakovic could have made a
free throw with two-tenths of a second remaining, the Sacramento
Kings would have been celebrating a thrilling comeback victory.
article.headline: Stojakovic can't win it, so Nowitzki does for Mavs in OT

images.name: Nash_Steve 120201 inline
images.caption: Steve Nash, right, tries to get around Mike Bibby on his way to a season-high 31 points.

article.linkText: Missed free throw leads to Kings' first home defeat
article.story:
SACRAMENTO, Calif. (AP) -- If Peja Stojakovic could have made a free throw with two-tenths of a second remaining, the Sacramento Kings would have been celebrating a thrilling comeback victory. Instead, Stojakovic missed, and Dirk Nowitzki scored seven of his 32 points in overtime Sunday night as the Dallas Mavericks became the first visiting team to win in Arco Arena this season, defeating the Kings 120-114. Stojakovic was fouled by Nowitzki with two-tenths of a second left in regulation. "It was all ball, I was surprised," Nowitzki said. "It was a tough call, a late decision. Peja is a human being, I thought when he went to the line it was over." He made the first free throw but missed the second, sending the game into overtime tied 105-105. Stojakovic, naturally, agreed with the call. "Of course I was fouled, that's what the referee called," he said. "I had a chance to finish it and I didn't." Nowitzki, who also had 14 rebounds and three blocks, scored the first four points in the extra period as the Mavericks won for the sixth time in seven games and avenged a defeat against the Kings four days earlier in Dallas. Steve Nash scored a season-high 31 points and Michael Finley added 19 points and seven assists. Stojakovic scored 31 points and Vlade Divac had 25 points and 17 rebounds for the Kings, who are now 7-1 at home. Hedo Turkoglu added 18 points and nine rebounds and Bobby Jackson added 16 points. "It was a tough loss, we didn't want to lose to them at home," Jackson said. "We dug ourselves a big hole and got out of it. I would take my chances anytime with Peja at the line." The Kings came back from a 23-point deficit by closing the third quarter with a 21-3 run, cutting Dallas' lead to 83-80. Stojakovic had 12 third-quarter points and Jackson had 11. Following a no-call on Nowitzki's drive to the basket in the second quarter, an irate Dallas coach Don Nelson stormed the court after referee Dee Kantner. He picked up two quick technicals and was ejected from the game. With Nelson in the locker room, the Mavericks outscored Sacramento 24-10 to take a 62-44 lead at the half. It was only the second time all year the Kings have trailed at the half. "We need to beat teams like Sacramento and get some road wins, so this was a great victory for us," said assistant coach Donn Nelson, who took over after his father was ejected. "It is very tough to get a win in this building." Game notes
The Mavericks made their first eight shots. Sacramento missed 22 of 27 shots in the second quarter and was outscored 30-15. Kings starting guard Doug Christie left the game in the third quarter. He needed seven stitches to close a wound on his right hand. ... Kings coach Rick Adelman has 496 victories in 11 seasons. Nelson is closing in on 1,000 victories. He now has 991.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
